title._content: ["Weld," Larz Anderson house, 151 Newton Street, Brookline, Massachusetts. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Weld," Larz Anderson house, 151 Newton Street, Brookline, Massachusetts. Water garden, temple at end of willow alley] [ca. 1914] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Little & Browne changes to existing house, from 1899. Landscape: Italian Garden Charles Adams Platt, planted and built, late 1899 or 1900-1901. Temple Architect: Little & Browne, 1911. Associated Name: Isabel Perkins (Mrs. Larz) Anderson. Other: Garden identified as the "Formal Garden" on 1903 plan by Little & Browne of Weld, Layout of Grounds & Buildings. Today: House not extant; land part of Larz Anderson Park. On slide (handwritten): "A" and "Anderson, Larz." Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16776 Call Number: LC-J717-X108- 49
